direction.raw_text: Huge mountains, destroyed STRUCTURES. Buildings enveloped by flows of earth. Awe-inspiring beauty.

direction.raw_text: They arrived almost half a century ago. Aliens, Scavs, whatever you want to call them. Their idea of how-do-you-do was to blow up our moon. Giant waterfalls crash where lava cooled through iron and concrete. Telephone polls half-buried in sand.

direction.raw_text: Without her moon, the earth went insane. Most were killed in the floods, as the cities came down, as everything caught fire. A year later their ground troops landed, to exterminate whoever was left. A station wagon half protrudes from a lava flow. A child's plastic flip-flops on the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Humanity had to flee the Earth. We had to unlearn what it meant, to call something our home. Now we live on the Tet, our man-made moon. A temporary home before the next step. Everyone's there now. (BEAT) Well, almost everyone.

direction.raw_text: I'm confirming it. I'm right here. Vika works her displays, scanning, wanting to keep him safe. The wreckage has strewn out thousands of flaming pieces of debris, all which register heat signatures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This thing is ancient, one of the old pre-war shuttles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The ship's guts are strewn across the earth. Several pod-like canisters strewn around, more fixed into the burning wreckage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rolling out of his Bubbleship even before it's settled. He heads straight into the burning wreckage, into hell. Heat SEARING his eyes, disorienting him. All around metal POPS and GROANS as it distends. He moves through metal panels, dodging flames and burning debris -- searching wildly. Jack sees what looks like a SURVIVOR! HAULS it over to discover it's only an empty NASA jumpsuit. But beyond that... A DELTA-SLEEP POD, split wide open. Its interior EMPTY. Jack moves on, finds another POD, presses his face against the glass...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: CRASH SITE -- CONTINUOUS JACK TOUCHES DOWN,

direction.raw_text: on the other side. A MAN, sleeping...

direction.raw_text: plumes into the dark sky. Jack STUMBLES ON, tracks another pod literally ON FIRE. Beyond that, a whole portion of the ship is semi-intact, the hull ripped lengthwise. Jack tracks a burnished STEEL CYLINDER with radioactive markings, locked in strong moorings... And near that, another POD, still locked in the ship's wall. Jack moves to it, wiping away soot and grime, pressing his face close and sees her... .THE BRUNETTE WOMAN FROM HIS DREAMS. She's asleep, her face lit by moving firelight. JACK is stunned. Eyes dart to readouts: She's alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Confused, amazed, moved. He puts a hand out, towards the glass of the pod...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! SVUNK! Behind Jack, plasma rounds impact the Pod with the man in it, the metal going nova, collapsing...

direction.raw_text: NO! 1! Cannon fire erupts all around him! TWO DRONES settle on the site, their weapons kicking out energy, locking on and destroying Pods...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NO! NO! They're firing on the ship. Vika, it's one of ours.

direction.raw_text: Victoria stares at her screens, perhaps for the first time in her life, frozen. Jack's voice blares over speakers.

direction.raw_text: There are people here, and they're killing them! Victoria opens her mouth to respond. She can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drone passes right over Jack, locks into position, lining its cannons on the Pod with the WOMAN in it... Jack moves between the Drone and the Pod. The Drone hesitates...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: him. Weapons literally red hot from repeated fire. The Drone SHIFTS AGAIN, FAST, looking for its shot. Jack counters, keeping his body between the Drone and the Pod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here! Go away! Get! A moment of insane bravado, Jack un-shoulders his weapon, strafes the Drone with gunfire which knocks it back. It re-centers, weapons chugging with energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Staring at the feeds. A screen catching a half-image of Jack firing at the Drone. She's absolutely still, holding her breath... Jack stares at the Drone, at certain death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what the hell are you waiting for? GO ON! And suddenly, the Drone moves on, Canons live, searching on into the wreckage, annihilating other Pods.

direction.raw_text: chest heaving... An instant of BLACK, shuttering back to:

direction.raw_text: A high-tech, high-powered RIFLE rests in two alien- armored hands. Like a metal-coated insect tarsus (barbed feet of a fly). The alien begins to depress the trigger... Then another tarsus presses the barrel down. Don't. Don't fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Close on an ALIEN. Our first real look, still too close to truly comprehend. Thick stubbled hair armored with metal, bones; A head-dress of authority. Behind layers of dusted cracked goggles, the older alien eye... blinks.

direction.raw_text: reaches the Bubbleship, heaves the Delta Pod onto the carrier which immediately secures it with armatures designed to carry damaged drones.

direction.raw_text: steals another look at the sleeping face of the

direction.raw_text: The Bubbleship flies up and up, The DELTA SLEEP POD securely hanging from its belly, carrying Jack and this mysterious woman away into the evening sky.

direction.raw_text: The WIND is wild and brutal. As the Bubbleship touches down, CLAMPS snap on the landing skids. Jack is in motion, bursting out of the ship. He glances up. Victoria stands behind the glass of the Sky Tower living room, staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He releases the armature. HAULS the Pod with him towards the house. HAMMERS ON THE GLASS.

direction.raw_text: Open it! Victoria obeys, opens the glass doors. WIND fills the living room as Jack hauls the Pod in. Then Victoria touches a control and the walls SEAL. (CONTINUED)

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it didn't recognize her. It's machinery. It's programmed

direction.raw_text: She came off a NASA shuttle. The drones were specifically targeting the pods -- VICTORIA I don't know what the machinery did or didn't do. There's protocol...

direction.raw_text: Protocol? Protocol?! Who's the machinery now, Victoria?

direction.raw_text: stares at him. Then retreats from the question into the task at hand. She kneels by the Pod.

direction.raw_text: Go get the cutter, and a breather, and my big bag. Now. The Pod's been damaged, she's not doing well, let's get her out of there. Jack moves. Victoria, almost holds back, but...

direction.raw_text: .This has to be reported.

direction.raw_text: . Stares at her. Really angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it does. And when we report it, we'll also report that drones slaughtered the other human survivors from one of our ships. See what they make of that. He goes for the equipment. Victoria stares at the woman's face, deeply unsettled... Jack returns with Victoria's bag, and firing up a CUTTER. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Right there, be careful... Jack directs the blue arc towards a seal. The Pod depressurizes with a sudden exhale of dead air. Jack pulls back the pod door. Inside, the woman lies in a gauzy sleep suit. Her hair is matted. Her body looks frail, her skin translucent, veins dark, lips blue, like a drowning victim. Vika pulls her feeding tube, takes her pulse, checks her eyes, lifting the lids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lift her up, we have to get some air into her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets his arms around the woman, pulling her upwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: seeps from her mouth... And suddenly she's ALIVE, COUGHING, spewing fluid across Jack and the floor. He sets her down as she painfully wretches, then SUCKS IN AIR. Her eyes flutter open. She's suddenly violently ill again. Instinctively, Jack goes to hold her -- VICTORIA (CONT'D) (PROFESSIONAL) No. Don't. Let her get the fluid out. The woman stops heaving. Looks up at both of them... She tries to stand, disoriented by the glass walls, the infinite vertigo that surrounds them. She falls to her knees and stares with amazement down into the clouds. Jack kneels beside her, puts a hand on her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're safe. You're in a skytower, on Earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .Jack. Victoria gives a sharp look at Jack. He's stunned. Now completely exhausted, the woman SLUMPS into unconsciousness. Jack catches her. Victoria comes close, slides an oxygen breather mask over her face. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to get her cleaned up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bizarre and almost beautiful tableau: ALL THREE together under the water, Jack holding the unconscious Woman like a child. The warm water spraying over their three forms, soaking the woman's gauzy suit which clings to her body. Water running across Jack and Victoria's faces, their open eyes, locked on each other. The water finally stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to get her up to the Tet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have the facilities here. Once she's stable...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. The glass door slides open behind them. Neither move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on? He shakes his head. He has no idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WOMAN lies in a bed. VICTORIA checks her readouts, adjusts her UV drip. She glances over her and realizes that the woman's eyes are open, staring at her. Beat. Victoria turns, offers the woman some water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Drink this. You're dehydrated... You've been in a very bad crash. Your ship came down. This DISTURBS the woman. She tries to sit up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the others? How did you get out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .Julia. Julia. The woman, JULIA, sinks back down, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to rest quietly. You've been in delta sleep for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best guess? About 65 years. Julia takes that in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Jack...? Julia STARTS. Looks down at her arm where Victoria has just slid a needle under her skin. She stares at her, almost afraid. Victoria depresses the plunger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhhhhh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Sky Tower a lonely refuge in a roiling storm, turning on its axis, like a weather-vane And we PLUNGE DOWN. Down and down, to the base of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to see...

direction.raw_text: battered by wind, rags blowing, raises its mask to the sky. Looking up towards the tower. It wears the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that we have seen before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SKY TOWER, DINING AREA - NIGHT Victoria is very subdued, poking at food. Both very aware of the woman sleeping in the infirmary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow, I'll report that we have her. Jack nods, but won't look at her. Deep in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack... (BEAT) What do you want from me, Jack? This isn't just a Shakespeare Sonnet, a buffalo nickel, some vase...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a Greek funeral vase. Which I want my ashes in, incidentally. Victoria collects the dishes, heads for the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just think we need to know why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, please. This isn't why we're here. This is just what we have to do before our real lives begin. We've given them five years and now we get to go home. (BEAT) So just leave this alone. It's not our job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what if I can't? They stare at each other, each obscurely frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julia sleeps, a mask taped to her face, oxygen hissing. Jack watches her. Now cleaned and dry, there's a natural, earthy, freckled beauty to her. Air passing peacefully through her lips, now returned to color. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack reaches out to brushes hair from her face. He notices the outline of a necklace with a pendant under her nightgown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria sets dishes in a dishwasher. She stops. She can see Jack in the Infirmary, staring at Julia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits in its hub, repaired. Jack replaces a panel, moves to a laptop and activates the drone. It POWERS UP, rising fast, bringing its canons around. We should be afraid, very afraid, that something is wrong with it. It SCANS Jack, as menacing as ever. But something's changed in Jack. He just stares back at it. Beat. Then the DRONE FIRES itself off into the black clouds, disappearing towards the earth below. Jack stares after it; then he turns, looks across empty space to the underside of the glass pool. Victoria has just dived in. She swims laps, kicking hard, bubblestreams peeling across her body. Exercise, not pleasure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack stands at the end of the pool, watches Victoria stoke powerfully towards him. She sees him as she reaches the edge, stops, looking up at him. This is important, something Jack's been wanting to say for a long time:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I read these books, of what it was like down here, before... He sits, his legs dangling into the water. She pulls up close, her arms on the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this one book I was reading, a man describes being a child. He remembers a yellow kitchen, a baked apple. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. That was the world before. Your little obsession...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was so wonderful about life on the Tet? She looks away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When our time is up next month. I want to put in for one more tour. Victoria pushes off from the side, drifts back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's almost all gone, Victoria. I want to be here for the end. She turns, resumes swimming laps. Hard, driving through the water. He watches her for a moment, then turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria comes in from the pool. She can see Jack in the bedroom, sitting on the bed, his back to her. She moves into the Infirmary, moves to Julia and checks her IV drip. She starts to adjust it, stops. She stares down at Julia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria comes in from the infirmary. She opens a closet, changes into a night shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and grabs him, desperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Please. Don't you understand? We have a chance to be on the first boats out, to be the first to settle Mars, raise a family. Five years. Proof that we are an effective team. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds his face, kisses him, willing him to want her as desperately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything we've wanted is waiting for us up there. Please, Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if it is or not, Victoria. I can't remember. She starts to reply... has nothing. Shakes her head. She grabs blankets and pulls them around herself, her back to him, her eyes open, scared. Jack also lies down, staring upwards. And then Jack asks the 64,000 dollar
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember her? Victoria doesn't move. Stares straight out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shakes the SKYTOWER, and the clouds boil beneath it. Jack and Victoria sleep next to each other. In the infirmary, Julia sleeps alone. A machine "beeps."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in the deep saturation of Jack's dream. Images fly by, then SLOW. People, enjoying the view. New York City. Jack, looking through the pay telescope. Then turning, seeing... Julia right next to him, smiling up, happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack's eyes open. That dream again. Victoria's still asleep next to him. He rises out of bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack pads out into the main room. STOPS when he sees Julia, risen from the infirmary, standing at one of the glass walls of the Sky Tower, staring out. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's early early morning. Probably 3:00 am. While it's dark below, the first signs of dark blue and orange sunrise are visible on the horizon. THE PLANETARY RING glows with soft golden light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : In the distance, the Tet is rising, faint light on its surface as it crests the planet's curve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Julia. The image of Tet reflected in the corneas of her eyes. She's been crying, silently, and alone. One hand at her chest.

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful, isn't it? It's your home now. (NO RESPONSE) How do you feel? She wipes her eyes.

direction.raw_text: A bit more... located.

direction.raw_text: Your ship... it's pre-war.

direction.raw_text: (again, careful) Have you ever seen a ship like that?

direction.raw_text: No. No, of course not. This answers something important for Julia.

direction.raw_text: I wonder what brought us back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .There was a transmission. I don't know who sent it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll never really know without the flight recorder. (almost casually...) She says we can't go down there, that it's too dangerous. He laughs a little, shakes his head.

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funnily enough, you've found your man.

direction.raw_text: Have I? An awkward beat, then:

direction.raw_text: .You look like someone I once knew. (extending her hand) I understand I owe you my life. Thank you, Jack. They shake. A weird moment. She breaks away, looks back at the Tet which now glows a pale orange on the horizon.

direction.raw_text: What happens now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a few hours, the Tet will come online. Victoria will report your rescue and I imagine they'll send someone down for you.

direction.raw_text: Yes. She gestures out to the Bubbleship on its pad. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: You fly that thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .You could say that. She SMILES, pleased. A twinkle in her eye...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright then. Don't you want to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and JULIA are suited up, ready to go. The Tetis still low and far on the dark horizon, silhouetted bythe first signs of sunlight growing in the East... The Bubbleship's ENGINES start up with their distinctive whine. As they head towards the ship, Victoria comes out from the house, a robe pulled on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack! What are you doing?

direction.raw_text: I'll bring her back before Tet- Rise. We just want to try to find the flight recorder. You can't know everything watching from a mile up.

direction.raw_text: She shouldn't be -- Julia turns on Victoria, quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. I feel very well. Then, coldly, she boards the ship.

direction.raw_text: She's the flight officer, she wants. to see the wreck of her ship and secure items there. You'd want to do the same thing.

direction.raw_text: Jack, please. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, we'll be back before you have to make your report.

direction.raw_text: That's not it. I can't protect you with the Tet offline and I just have a very bad...

direction.raw_text: I'll be fine. He turns and boards. Julia is staring at her through the bubble-canopy. The bubbleship rises and then falls off to the side, plummeting towards earth.

direction.raw_text: Jack pulls the ship out of its dive, sets course across the altered earth. Julia is STARING down, a little afraid, but darkly fascinated... Victoria's voice cuts through on the Comm.

direction.raw_text: Jack... This isn't just about protocol. I'm trying to understand.

direction.raw_text: I'll be home for breakfast. And he SWITCHES OFF the Comm.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the panel with her fists. She backs off, staring at the panel.

direction.raw_text: They fly in silence. Julia gazes down at sights we're by now familiar with, becoming visible as the first light hits. The craters, emaciated seascape. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I guess I'm around... a hundred years old. (BEAT) What happened next? He gestures towards the moon ring in the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Scavs assumed taking out the moon would wipe us out, and it almost did. But we re-grouped, fought back. We beat them in the end. She glances at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's if you call nuking half the planet beating anybody. He looks at her, shrugs. They fly past a RESOURCE GATHER, its column of water lifting from the seas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We harvest seawater to supply the Mars colony with the energy we need to live there. We're almost done. Pretty soon, there'll be no more water down here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dry planet... He nods at the Tet, rising in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. What's left of us are up there now, ready to go where you were headed, Mars. 40 acres and a mule. What we've got left. What you've got. Julia stares out at the Tet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were born and raised up there. Vika's the A-student. I'm just a tech... I fix things. I... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him. Something out of the groove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you looking at me like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. She stares back down at the landscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so beautiful. He looks at her, surprised. He thought he was the only one...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits landed amidst the wreckage. A low still fog has condensed, leaving visibility low, moisture everywhere. While there was light up high, they've descended back into the pre-dawn darkness. The ROVER has detached, shining its small light in their direction to help. Julia searches fruitlessly. Everything from the wreck small enough to carry away has been taken by Scavs. Every piece of fabric and metal. Jack half watches her, half tracks the periphery, his weapon slung low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria sits at her workstation, upset. She's got the Bubbleship up on the map, its cam feed on display.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julia, still weakened from Delta Sleep, hauls aside debris, revealing a metal floor-plate, unscrewed and discarded. The slot within is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! NO! It's been taken. DAMN IT! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She backs off, upset, breathing hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, it doesn't matter -- JULIA It matters, okay!? You don't... you can't understand... I need that flight recorder. I need to know what happened. (BEAT) You need to know what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should stay close to... She ignores him, moves on. Deeper in the wreckage, she locates the empty moorings that held the Steel Cylinder Jack saw. It's also gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was it? She STARES at him, wanting to say something. Deciding not to. She leans back against a wall of the shuttle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria has tried to ignore the cam feeds, working on other things. She glances over, then away just as a FORM passes by one of the cam feeds! Victoria checks another readout, glances back as TWO MORE FORMS pass by the camera. Glimpses of metal and fur...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hitting the Comm) Jack! Jack! There's something coming your way. JACK!!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CRASH SITE - CONTINUOUS Jack's Bubbleship sits silent. The COMM still switched off. Suddenly ANOTHER FORM moves through our line of sight, something's there, and CLOSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and JULIA. The air still, damp. Almost no sound. She picks through the remains of the ship. He's staring at her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (without looking up) You're staring at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Victoria watches as MORE AND MORE Alien figures pass the camera feed. Moving towards Jack and Julia's position. Victoria, HELPLESS. Julia looks up at Jack, directly for the first time. He stares at her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I know you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Suddenly her vision racks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees emerging out of the mist, SCAVS. A dozen of them. Alien tribesmen, bristling with weapons, war-like high-tech headdresses. Mandibles and claws. Terrifying and close. Jack reaches for his weapon, bringing it around and -- SLAM! He's hit from the side by a SCAV. Its armored body bringing him to the ground. He tries to CRAWL AWAY, sees Julia grabbed. He twists, sees Scavs crawling over the Bubbleship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob! HOME! In the background, the Bubbleship BLASTS OFF, Scavs falling off as Jack KICKS BACKWARDS, breaking the Scavs hold. He rolls away towards his weapon- - straight into the legs of a GIANT SCAV holding an improvised club which now comes down, IMPACTING JACK...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at image of the wreck growing SMALLER as the Bubbleship rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! JACK...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darkness. LOUD SOUNDS. ANIMAL PANTING. Small, glimpses of earth moving by, then darkness again. Jack and Julia are tied to a huge SCAV SLED pulled by twelve FERAL DOGS. A combination of old scavenged military hardware and new innovation to adapt to a world without engine-power. Giant treads roll forward as the dogs STRAIN against metallic harnesses. Jack's head lolls to the side. He blinks, looks over to see Julia next to him, unconscious. He tracks up. At the top of the sled, a massive Alien Scav pilots the sled, sand whipping through a head-dress we recognize: The LEADER. He holds a long whip, cracks it over the dogs who haul the sled forward. We slow, letting the sled pull away from us into the dark as we travel BACK, towards where we came from, reveal... The Bubbleship's ROVER has been following. A machine meant for small journeys, it rolls inside the tread path left by the sled, but it can barely handle the terrain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria hears the SOUND OF THE BUBBLESHIP, arriving. She rushes to the glass of the Sky Tower, sees the Bubbleship, docking itself. Auto pilot. No one inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From far away, we see the sled wind up this rocky canyon which opens onto a massive wall of old concrete and steel. Something giant and industrial in its time. The sled approaches, seems to disappear as it moves under a shadowy outcropping of rock. In the dark underneath, huge metal doors... close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A DARK SPACE -- NO TIME Almost complete blackness, just the SOUND of a slow drip of water. In the far distance, the howls and chatter of Scavs. Jack's blood-encrusted eyes blink open. Irises dilate trying to orient. He raises his head, can barely see. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and Julia lie in the only pool of light in the room, filtering in from a high ventilation shaft. She's unconscious. Around him, in the dark, the sense of movement. His eyes adjusting, he squints into the dark. There's a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the edges of the light, watching him. Jack tenses as the figure... .strikes a match on the floor, brings the flame to its face, revealing... An Old Man: BEECH. He sucks in on the end of a cigar. For a moment, their eyes meet. Then the match goes out. Dark silhouette again. Only the feint orange glow from the cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MonteCristo, #2. Do you have any idea how long I've waited, for this? He EXHALES a stream of smoke into the beam, then moves closer, into the light. Beech's face is lined with age and exposure, his skin scarred from battle. His teeth yellowed and crooked, but his arms and body are strong. Jack TENSES. Beech's voice is calm, with a barely held- back malice lurking just under the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, let me tell you, Jack. It's been a long time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? Where is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: inhales again. There's a piercing curiosity to Beech's gaze, studying him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're deep underground. Very deep underground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were taken by the Scavs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... The "Scavs". (BEAT) Tell me, Jack. Have you ever met a Scav, up close? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack is suddenly aware of other FORMS in this room. Motion, on the periphery. Hair... Feathers. Scavs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, of course not. You just repair the damage, keep the Drones up and killing. Don't ask many questions, do you, Jack? No part of the... (BITTER TASTE) .job description. Beech pulls off the cigar...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brutal, if you think about it. The way your Drones -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Scavs took everything from us. And if you're working with them -- BEECH Interesting, Jack. Interesting. You're worried I might be some kind of... Collaborator. Jack doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lllllllights! A beat, then a BANK of lights flickers on, revealing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all around them, heavily armed. Julia GROANS, the light bringing her to. Jack moves to protect her, tracks ten, TWENTY people... He looks UP where ROWS AND ROWS of men and women stare down from above with undisguised animosity. Forty, fifty more... At the front, a strong battle-scared Scav, SYKES, hovers on the edge of violence. He's been recently WOUNDED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see...? We're not Aliens, Jack. We're very much human. Jack can't process. Human face after human face. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course that's a problem. Your drones go for human shapes, human voices. So... we change our shapes, change our voices. (INHALING SMOKE) The Drones still kill us, but they're not nearly so aggressive as when they smell a human target. Did you ever ask yourself why that is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, they're programmed to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To what, Jack? (OFF JULIA) You saw it yourself. You almost got yourself blown to bits protecting her. I've been meaning to ask you, why did you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone would have...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone. Would have. Interesting. Julia comes around, her eyes flickering open, She
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looking frantically for an escape. Jack GRABS her, protecting her, calming her. Beech gets CLOSE, studies Jack, what he's doing. Nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very interesting. Beech moves away. Jack moves after him and suddenly forty or more weapons lock onto him. Sykes closer than any other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, Jack. I'm afraid you're not very popular here. Beech switches his gaze to Julia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome back to earth, commander. Hope you like what we've done with the place. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beech moves on. Jack and Julia follow, cautiously...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pass into a giant area devoted to agriculture. ROWS of wide, two-story glass tubes hold PLANTS bearing fruit. Their roots are held bare, bathed only in moist air...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We grow what we can, under the lights. It isn't much; Wheat- grass, some vegetables, what beans and soy we can. The general state of our health proves that human beings are not herbivores, but the alternative is not appetizing to anybody. (SARDONIC WINK) Not yet, anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When we get you up to the Tet, there's plenty -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is? Plenty. Plenty of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Food.Foreveryone. (BEAT) Look,it'samazing you've lasted thislong.But the radiation zonesare growing. All of this, willbe gone soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The zones... the area you don't patrol...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one does. You go there --- BEECH -- Your organs boil from the inside. I've heard. Beech moves on, turning down another corridor. There are PAINTINGS, stacked against the walls. Picasso, Monet, Kandinsky, Warhol. SCULPTURES in piles. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Grand Piano is pushed in a corner, other instruments propped against it. They pass a room filled with BOOKS, another with a SCREEN mounted in front of a projector. For a moment, Jack forgets everything else. It's like his private collection at Crater Lake, but a hundred times bigger, richer... Julia stops in front of a painting of a young girl in a field of golden grass, staring towards a farmhouse on the horizon. She turns to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It reminds me of home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is communicating with the Tet. She has been crying, sick with worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's disappeared. (CORRECTING HERSELF) My Technical Officer, Jack Harper. He's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time since last contact?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .Six hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Protocol states 24 hours before reporting a loss of contact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Scavs took him. I witnessed it. He has a... A beat. Victoria experiencing jealousy she didn't fully understand before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a woman with him. The survivor of the crashed shuttle, Julia Sommerville. Silence. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prep the survivor for immediate evac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, she's with the Technical Officer. I'm requesting permission to re-task the Drones for search and rescue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Permission granted. Victoria gets to work on the console, re-tasking Drones. Another TONE makes her look over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT'D) You doing okay, Vika?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I mean. I don't know. Tet Comm Status: "COMMUNICATION ENDED."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack and Julia are held back by Scavs as up ahead Beech's second-in-command, the battle-hardened SYKES, whispers heatedly in his ear, glancing back. Not everyone thinks having Jack and Julia here is a good idea. Jack peers over the edge of the gantry they are on. FAR BELOW, ancient GEOTHERMAL TURBINES churn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, what he said about the Tet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not looking at her) It took three decades to build the Tet. And when it was finally ready and it was time to go up, there were people who refused. Leaders, who told their people to stay. Staring at Beech, the glint in the man's eyes... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so they stayed. And they were slaughtered. Whatever the conversation is, it doesn't go well. Sykes storms off, angry. Other Scavs go with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ROVER has reached the Canyon, starts to make its way in towards Raven Rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vika is on a tear, working hard. Unable to reach Jack, she's looking for any clue, anything to help find him. To that end she's replaying the recordings of her last transmission from the Bubbleship. We hear her last
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack! Jack! There's something coming your way. JACK!!!! Victoria LISTENS, chilled. She hits REWIND, then PLAY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .It'll be fine. Trust me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be home for breakfast. Alone in the Sky Tower, this hits Victoria hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Victoria STARES at the counter, letting it go further back. Then, PLAY. Just STATIC. Then we hear Victoria's end of a conversation we already witnessed:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT'D) I'm near the... .border territory. .still more than five clicks from the... beacons... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing out there so far, Jack? Then the static for a moment filled with GARBLED SOUNDS. Victoria hits STOP. She stares. Makes an adjustment, plays the SOUNDS again. Something drawing her in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Large bay, filled with machinery, computers. Other things scavenged from the wreck of the Odyssey including several Delta Sleep Pods. Scav Soldiers work in the center of the bay on a DOWNED DRONE. It's been opened up, taken apart. All of its circuit boards and wiring spread out, hooked to computers. To the side, other soldiers are grouped around something. Jack tracks the object they're working on: The scarred
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack saw on the Odyssey. Its been opened up and some ten scavenged Deuterium fuel cells have been fitted inside the casing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bomb... She REALIZES something, wheels on Beech, angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You brought down the Odyssey. You sonofabitch you crashed our ship. There were people on board, all so you could get -- BEECH I know what I did. But tell us, Commander, why did you have a bomb on board, what was it for? Tell him. She looks at Jack, reluctant to say it, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tet... is an alien ship, Jack. The odyssey's mission --- Our mission, was to investigate it. Jack shakes his head no. Angry... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It attacked us. First it destroyed our moon. Then it unleashed its primary weapon, a brilliant weapon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was born there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was born in Chicago, Jack. I used to go to baseball games with my father. I used to get two big hot dogs, fill 'em up with relish, and mustard. Just go to town. Me and my pops, watching the sox. (quick, pressing) You have any memories like that Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, my father was a -- BEECH Was what? Tall? Fat? He yell at your mom? Ever go to a baseball game, Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already told you -- BEECH Right, sorry. Tell me how your mother smelled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother, smelled like warm fruit. Like oranges, sitting in the sun. Jack starts to speak... Stops. Beech moves to one of the scavenged DELTA SLEEP PODS, runs his hand over the embossed name-plate... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you had looked more carefully at the wreckage of the odyssey, you would have noticed there were two empty sleep pods. The Pilot, and the Co-pilot... Jack stares at the name plate on the POD: "J. Harper."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was you, Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and Victoria. We were all on the Odyssey. We were supposed to make contact...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tet is an alien vessel, Commander Jack Harper. It came and destroyed our moon and most of humanity when it did. And ever since, with your help, it's been trying to finish the job. (BEAT) I'm sorry, Jack. It's not good news, I know. You've been turned to the wrong side. Beech goes to the BOMB, stares down at it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now, with your help, we can finally destroy it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're insane. This is insane. He turns to Julia, but she won't help him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to both of them) There are people up there -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? People like you? We are the last real people. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pockets like this one, hiding out, dying. Probably all over the planet. Beech raises his gaze to Jack. Deadly serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't win the war, Jack. We lost. These words hit Jack. He starts to reply, finds he can't. Beech approaches, fatherly, gentle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has taken us ten years to get here, but we finally have a weapon, and a working Drone to carry it. Except we can't successfully program the Drone. It's not our technology. (CLASPING HIS SHOULDERS) But you can, repairman. That is the beautiful irony. It gave you the skills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ROVER crawls up the Canyon finally arrive at the entrance to Raven Rock. It stops, scanning the face of Raven Rock...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! A SHOT hits it, it tumbles back, utterly destroyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria is working hard, intent on deciphering the sound. She doesn't notice the image of Raven Rock appear on a side monitor, transmitted from the ROVER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, SYKES and several other Scavs burst into the area. All eyes go to Jack and Julia as the ruined ROVER is brought in. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It followed him here. I told you this was a mistake! Beech, processing. All around the periphery, REACTION. This is a disaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well well, we may be out of time. Set the Drone to return to the Tet upon reactivation. It needs to go right to the center -- JACK No! It will kill -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will kill that ugly stain on the sky. That's all! Now program the Drone! Soldiers push Jack towards the opened Drone. Jack stares at the read-outs, the electronics. Sykes GRABS a weapon from a female Scav soldier, lines it on Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I won't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't help us. We bury them both, make our run as soon as we can load up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! Jack stares Sykes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I stare into weapons every day, so you can put that away. Because here's what I can tell you... (back to Beech) If the Rover found us, the Drones will too. Unless you want them to find you, let me get somewhere where I can send a signal. Somewhere far from here. Beech... caught. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your plan, Jack? Tell the Tet where we are, so they can send a nice big welcome -- JACK The Drones would kill you. Let me try to stop that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't trust him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (staying on Beech) You're wasting time. On Beech, Sykes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RAVEN ROCK - MOMENTS LATER Jack and Julia stand near the entrance to Raven Rock. Sykes appears with the white rectangular box, tosses it down in the dirt at Jack's feet. Beech watches as Jack unfolds his motorcycle. Behind them, other Scavs are packing up, readying an exodus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can fix this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're the repairman. Jack powers up the bike and gets on. He looks at Julia who hesitates, then she climbs on the back of the bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get to the antenna, send a signal with my location. The Tet will call off the search. .You should be safe, for now. Jack starts to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack... What if I told you that I had been to your radiation zones. And what I found there... Would change everything you think you know about the world. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack looks at him, hearing this. Then GUNS the bike. Beech stares after them, the rooster-tail of Jack's bike racing away across the ruined landscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you think he's any different from the others? Beech stares at him a moment, then back out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She does. Beech turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack pilots the electric bike across STAGGERING BEAUTIFUL VISTAS... LANDSCAPES OF THE IMAGINATION. On the back of the bike, Julia takes in the incredible beauty around her. Finally, in the shadow of a jagged mountain, the BIKE slows and STOPS. Jack checks the charge: it's dead. They climb off and Jack leaves the bike where it lies, headed off on foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened...? She's staring into the distance where an old WRECK of a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lies shattered against a cliff-face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Scavs brought it down ten years ago. All. this time, I thought we were at war with the Scavs... but it turns out we were just killing each other. He turns, heads off on foot. After a moment, she follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack and Julia reach the top of a high cliff, with what looks like a METAL SPIRE protruding upwards at its edge. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We PASS OVER them, staring down a familiar 1,200-foot waterfall. Jack has returned to the top of the Empire State, this time approaching from above. Together, they climb DOWN the craggy rock face. Two tiny figures against a massive backdrop, a mortal fall below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack is the first to drop onto the cracked cement of the deck. He moves forward, pulling the plastic and camouflage off the transmitter and repeater. He gets to work on the repeater. It's old tech, hard to make it talk to the Bubbleship. Julia stands a ways off. For a moment, their gazes meet, then he continues working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria is hard at work, processing the sound that caught her attention. She has it playing through the whole sky tower: The SOUNDS are broken, static-like, almost ALIEN. Strange and guttural. Fingers fly over controls, making adjustments. This time the sounds parse into WORDS. A male and a female voice. Almost apprehensive, she pulls an electronic filter, overlays it on the signal, which suddenly drops into perfect clarit : A recording of Jack and Victoria, from a different patrol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .And I want a dishwasher, the kind that you can put -- JACK'S VOICE I don't think they'll have those on Mars, Honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, fine. No dishwasher. How about just you. All the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. When we get there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her face totally still. Strangely frozen in the face of this sweet little exchange... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then a SOB breaks from her lips. The kind you can't control. Her fingers SHAKING, BADLY, she plays the recording, puts it on a loop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SKY TOWER - CONTINUOUS The voices BOOM through the Sky Tower, over and over. Frightening that their simplicity contrasts so much with the effect they are having on Victoria who moves into the main room, white as a sheet. She looks up as.. The Bubbleship lifts off from its platform and sails into the sky. She watches it go, then rushes back towards her station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack stares at the ESB Antenna, down at the repeater and the line of code he hopes he's transmitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will you do now? Jack doesn't answer. He moves to the edge of the deck, stares out, unwilling to meet her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That old man is smart. Those fuel cells, the way he's got them tied in with your device... He could blow the whole station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, you can't turn them in. He glances at her, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want from me? I'm just a repairman. (BEAT) This is bigger than me. Jack moves off to a corner of the deck by the old telescope. She follows him, steeling herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and I started the same year at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't really about space for me, it was about... what could be out there. Life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, stop, okay? Just -- JULIA But for you, it was always the stars. You wanted to fly further and faster than any one else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know who you're talking
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking about a man I knew, who was fearless. A man who wouldn't bow out of a fight, ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! You and that old man have this story... Except I know who I am, okay? I know who I am!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you don't. That thing brainwashed you, it erased your
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns, starts to lean on the old telescope, draws back, staring at the thing like it bit him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right... What do you remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The auto-piloted Bubbleship skims over the surface of downtown, headed towards the Empire State... Jack is staring at the telescope, agitated, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do I... what is it about this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten days before we got our go- ahead, you asked me to meet you here. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : VICTORIA. Eager to find out where the Bubbleship is headed, she punches up the live feed. Julia comes close, puts a hand out, rests it on his chest. She moves closer to him, searching his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you remember what happened here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Bubbleship now moving UP the waterfall. Victoria, leaning forward, watching the feeds... Julia takes one of his hands, places it around her waist. Moves closer still...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I sleep. You're always there. She kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is staring out over glorious intact New York City. Next to her, a YOUNGER JACK peers through the telescope. Now he pulls away, turns to her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There, right there. Take a look. She smiles, puts her eye to the telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tall billboard, with the girl on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay. I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nervously produces an ENGAGEMENT RING from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, pan to the right, slowly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: over as he directed, to a billboard, half-covered by a large canvas. The words "JULIA, WILL YOU MARRY ME?" clear on the canvas. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE SOUND OF A BUBBLE SHIP

direction.raw_text: Julia... She GASPS, looks over. There he is, holding the ring -- VRROOOOOM! THE SOUND OF A BUBBLE SHIP...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The Bubbleship RISES INTO VIEW directly in front of them. Jack, kissing Julia, tries to break away, confused, guilty. Julia holds on. She reaches to her collar, pulls free a necklace, a familiar ring dangles from it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are a few pages missing, but it's the same book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria stares at the screen, the image of Jack kissing Julia, then breaking away. She's strangely cold, like there's simply nothing left to feel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack pilots the ship, a tense silence between he and Julia. He checks a few readouts, then hits the Comm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vika, it's me. I'm... all right. I'm coming in. Don't report in to Mission, not until I get back. No response. Dead air. Julia is pressed far back in her seat, watching Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria is still motionless. She hears Jack's calls on the Comm, does nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .I'm 20 minutes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes Victoria look over. The Tet, checking in. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mission requests status of survivor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to hell. Beat. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did not copy. (LONG BEAT) Have you located your partner? Vika is silent. The Tet waits for a response. It doesn't get one. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT'D) Are you still an effective team?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. A long painful silence. Tears flow without sobs. Tet Comm Status: "COMMUNICATION ENDED." Victoria. pushes away from the console, numb. As she leaves the room, we STAY on the console... which suddenly comes alive. Readouts go active, data history starts to play. The Tet is accessing everything. Visual and Voice recordings blaze by. Images, everything the Bubbleship has seen. We see the image of Raven Rock sent from the ROVER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria enters the Sky Tower, staring at it as if it was all alien to her. As she moves through, she unzips her jumpsuit, steps out of it, moves on. Her shirt, then bra, land on the floor. She moves on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and JACK step out of the Bubbleship, head towards the interior of the Sky Tower. The whole thing has been opened up. Wind blows freely through papers, magazines. Vases have been blown over, water spilled. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are petals, Rose petals, swirling everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack comes out near the garden. It's been ripped to shreds. What plants are left lie uprooted and broken. Flowers strewn about. PETALS float off the side of the sky tower and down into the clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands near the far edge, looking out. She's no longer in her jumpsuit. She wears a beautiful flowing dress which waves in the wind. Her hair is free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vika... the Scavs. They're humans, like us. The war has become some giant... mistake. She turns. The heartbreak in her face clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw you. I saw you two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking her head) Stay away from me with the truth! I don't want the truth. I preferred oblivion. Victoria looks up, sees Julia in the distance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never really loved me, did you, Jack? His silence is LOUD. She LAUGHS, tears flowing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (broken for her) Vika, she was my wife. She looks at the infinite sky, the clouds, and as the TET appears... He steps towards her and she backs towards the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told them. The drones will be here. For her. For you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack feels the sting of this betrayal, but quickly accepts it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then come with me. (she shakes no) Don't you see what it means? There are still people, living on Earth. Surviving on earth. People like us. Victoria hears that and laughs, bitter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vika? Her laughter dies. She looks at him, strangely calm, beautiful in this moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jack. I think they made us. Victoria steps backwards. Jack LUNGES forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are falling towards us from the skytower, and then, so is VICTORIA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack stares after Victoria for one terrible beat, then falls to his knees. Not yet feeling, in shock. Julia approaches, slowly... He turns at her so fast she's afraid and steps back but he blows right by her, into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack enters Victoria's station. Trespassing in a space that doesn't belong to him. His eyes play over the room: A cup of coffee, now cold. A jacket on the back of her chair. On a monitor, a wavelength plays silently. The signal she descrambled. He looks at the Tet Communication Device. We realize he's never spoken directly to the Tet before. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Technician Jack Harper. The signal goes out. Beat. Beat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is your Control Officer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prep the survivor for immediate evac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear what I said? She's dead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prep the survivor for immediate evac. You will be reassigned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to talk to somebody. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be good to have you back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! I want to hear your voice! Beat. Beat. Tet Comm Status: "Communication Ended." He stares at this last transmission. Then looks up to the big map. From all over the sector, DRONES are closing on the Sky Tower. Closing on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack comes back out, heading towards the ship. Julia puts out a hand to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUBBLESHIP - CONTINUOUS Jack and Julia streak across the sky in the Bubbleship. On the heads-up display, they can clearly see the radiation border marked RED in front of them, and the two
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: closing behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beech said to look in the radiation zones. I have to go there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if he's just a crazy old man? Jack looks at her. It'd be a funny moment, but it's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been wrong about everything else. He dives the ship towards the clouds below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drones shoot down a canyon towards RAVEN ROCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bubbleship BURSTS through clouds. Up ahead, the familiar RIDGELINE is approaching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jack HAULS the ship over as the Drones bear down on them
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We recognize one: Drone 166. Canon fire ROCKS the Bubbleship, pieces blowing off. Jack REVOLVES THE CANOPY to return fire. A Drone
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but Drone 166 and another blast through the smoke, firing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything has been packed, loaded, ready to leave. Beech watches Sykes supervise the final lashing of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: onto a sled. Beech gives a command and the great steel door groans OPEN, revealing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waiting. Their weapons POWERING UP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a final realization washing over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack SPINS the ship, evading pursuit, even as he checks his heads-up, tracks the two Sky Tower Drones closing from behind. He hauls over, pursuing Drones turning with him, firing as the two Drones burst out of cloud cover
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: two more Drones go down! Jack hits the brakes. Another Drone overshoots him, pulls up. Jack sites the Drone, starts to fire... The Bubbleship is raked with fire! Drone 166 is right on them and firing. The canopy is hit! CRACKS spider-web across it. A canon is blown clean off. Jack tries his remaining weapon. It's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It pulls out of an arc, ACCELERATES, closing on the Bubbleship as the Bubbleship tears away into a cloud bank, goes in. Drone 166 follows, seconds behind. Drone 166 EMERGES from the cloud bank into open air, its cannon lining on... nothing. Empty sky. It REVOLVES quickly, sensing for ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Jack's Bubbleship IMPACTS the Drone from above, the ship's manacles designed for transporting broken Drones CLAMPING ON. Suddenly the two vessels are LOCKED. And the Drone goes wild. It's engines THRUSTING, fighting against the counter-force of the Bubbleship's engines. The Drones GUNS BLASTING in every direction, but unable to elevate to hit the Bubbleship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Julia screams as the ship tumbles end over end. Jack stays on the controls, tracking the last Drone closing from above. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack FORCES Drone and ship to turn, turning Drone 166's canon on the last Drone which EXPLODES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There... He punches the throttle. The Bubbleship with Drone 166 attached blasts in the direction of A CLIFF FACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets free of one restraint, rotates so its cannon come to bear on part of the undercarriage. OPENS UP, blasting the storage to bits... And Jack PULLS UP, just clearing the ridge, Drone 166 IMPACTING ROCK. The Drone blasts clear through, CRASHES ONTO VOLCANIC ROCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack and Julia in the damaged, smoking, now-shaking ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Jack nods, turns the ship north again. The Bubbleship shaking and smoking. Up ahead, the RIDGELINE approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: trigger on the Bubbleship's display Claxon-like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Radiation warning. We're five clicks from the border. Jack makes an adjustment, the Bubbleship SURGES with more speed. It sounds like it's going to tear itself apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The smashed Drone 166 POWERS BACK UP. A moment as it runs its systems, then BLASTS OFF in pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the heads-up, they can see Drone 166 coming up behind them, closing FAST. Jack touches a familiar button. The Bar-guage for his extra boost starts to fill...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: RED WARNING TEXT STREAMS ACROSS THE CANOPY

direction.raw_text: THEM, blasts go wide. Drone 166 is firing, missing. The bar gauge FALTERS, something broken. Jack SLAMS the dash. Gauge keeps rising. The Bubbleship starts to buck as RED WARNING TEXT STREAMS ACROSS THE CANOPY: "LETHAL RADIATION LEVELS APPROACHING. DO NOT ENTER."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got this. Jack hits it. They're both propelled back into their seats. The radiation zone coming up fast... They CROSS INTO THE ZONE!! .and the Bubbleship goes completely DEAD. Jack works controls, punches at the display. But there's nothing. Just the whistling sound of wind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob! BOB! What are you doing Bob!!!!! Bob just bobbles... BLAM! BLAM BLAM!! The blasts from Drone 166 impact them, helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on!! Jack grabs a level, a mechanical lever, and HAULS IT UP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The dead body of the ship tumbles backwards as Drone 166 BLASTS IT, tries to pull up but the Bubbleship IMPACTS Drone 166 which SPINS OUT OF CONTROL towards the ground.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE COCKPIT OF THE SHIP SEPARATES FROM THE BODY

direction.raw_text: skims the surface, IMPACTS a ridge, blasting through it. It hits another ridge, the canopy shattering, earth piling in on them as they finally grid to a stop. Jack groans, leans to checks that Julia is okay. She's coughing, dazed, but alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack opens the canopy door. It falls off. He stumbles out, himself still dazed. Wind and sand blow around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He breathes in. Breathes again. Waiting for a painful death, that doesn't arrive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch, old man... Words die on his lips as he tracks the plume of smoke from the downed Drone 166, lifting over a nearby ridge. He turns back to the ruined ship, grabs his carbine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay here. Jack runs towards the smoke which is already being blown clear by a rising sand storm. He flops down in the dirt at the top of the rise, bringing his weapon up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It lies smashed and smoking at the bottom of an incline. Finally dead. The wind and sand are beginning to whistle now, growing intensity... Jack starts to stand... when a FAMILIAR SOUND makes him turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jack hits the dirt as A BUBBLESHIP, just like Jack's, screams overhead and lands next to the DRONE, in a moment eerily reminiscent of the first scene of the film. Below, a MAN gets out of the second Bubbleship. He wears the same kind of suit as Jack. ANOTHER REPAIR MAN. He's got a bandana wrapped around his lower face to shield him from the sandstorm. Jack reaches for his BINOCS, bring them to his face only to find the lenses shattered. Reaching the downed Drone, the MAN kneels next to it and in a familiar fashion begins utilizing his tools to fix Drone 166. He locks a damaged cannon back into place, tightens it... Jack suddenly realizes what the man's doing. He stands, the wind now blasting in his direction, he starts running down the hill towards the man. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Hey, wait! Stop! Don't touch that Drone! His words are eaten up by the wind and sand. He rushes forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We only see his hands as he works on Drone 166. He's very good. Even in the growing sandstorm he clips out a ruined board, slots a new one in. Runs a by-pass around a wire-bundle. The Repairman's fingers go to a familiar switch to activate the Drone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Wait! The Repairman hears the voice, even as he flips the switch. He LEAPS BACK, spinning around, his carbine coming off his back, lined on Jack fifteen feet away who
direction.name: direction

result.heading: STARES BACK AT HIM IN UTTER ASTONISHMENT

direction.raw_text: -- THE REPAIRMAN. Holding the weapon on him. The man is Jack. A cleaner, newer, but identical version of Jack... A CLONE. Jack stares, transfixed. Now it all makes sense: The Garbled transmissions, Victoria's last words, who or what he really is, and is not. Not so for Jack 2. He takes a step back, confused, horrified. A tense moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack!? Julia has just crested the rise, sees the two Jack's. Also understanding...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julia! Stay back! Jack 2 senses her movement, SPINS and AIMS his rifle as Jack rushes forward -- JACK (CONT'D) No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He HITS JACK 2 and they both go down, the weapon
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! They fight over the weapon. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blow for blow combat, their physical strength and training identical, the only exception being that JACK 2 is fresh, his suit immaculate, a man who has just arrived at work, maybe just arrived on the planet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Standing, watching the two clones fight... she suddenly drops to her knees, her hand on her side. Blood seeps between her fingers. She's been shot, badly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jack grapples with Jack 2, trying to control him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STOP! You have to understand! You have to understand... Jack 2 throws Jack, leaps on top of him, trying to throttle him, in a full panic. Jack drives up into his gut, rolls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just Drones! We're just Drones, man! You and me! Don't you get it? Don't you know? Jack 2 comes at Jack wildly, emotion over-amping technique. Jack DUCKS the blow, wraps Jack 2 up in a choke-hold. SQUEEZING...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. It's going to be okay... Jack 2 goes limp, unconscious. Jack lets him go, staggers back. Everything finally processing. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julia... He turns towards Julia, sees her kneeling there, holding her side. The blood seeping between her fingers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs to her as she begins to fall. She is conscious, but just barely. But still, she PULLS BACK from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch me. Don't She lurches away from him, body running on fear and adrenaline. Jack nods, accepting her terror of him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves forward, lifts her up against her willand carries her to shelter among the rocky terrain closeby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack sets her down. There's blood frosting her lips and her skin has gone pale. He looks back, sees the Bubbleship and Jack 2's form lying next to it. He realizes something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack climbs in, looks around at the interior of the ship, at the similarities. He stares out at the unconscious Jack 2 in front of the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One, Two, Three. Jack Harper. A moment... then lights sparkle across the board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... Let's go home. The Bubbleship 2 lifts off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUBBLESHIP 2 - DAY (LATER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Making the approach. And then he sees it: Another Sky Tower, just like his. It had to be there. The Bubbleship closes on this new Sky Tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A woman we know but do not know is starting her new garden. VICTORIA 2. She looks happier, a little younger and more radiant than the Victoria we knew. It's earlier in their tour. Victoria 2 looks up as the Bubbleship lands. SMILES as Jack gets out and crosses the bridge towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're early... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he approaches she notices his damaged environmental suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened out there? I lost contact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at her, heartbroken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .Just a bit of a dust up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right? He nods. She comes over to him. He marvels at her beauty, the simplicity of life here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .What? She comes close, brushes his hair away from his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dreamed a lot last night. I was thinking, you have to start writing them down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cut myself, I just came by for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'll get it. He kisses her. Gentle, loving...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get it. You stay here. And as JACK goes into the sky tower, she returns to happily planting her roses. Oblivious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Jack heads through his work area he sees A COLLECTION. Just started, but not much different from his own. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some coins, a book, THE COLLECTED POEMS OF T.S. ELLIOT, left open to a page, a passage underlined. He reads: We shall not ceasefromexploration And the end of allourexploring will be to arrivewherewe first started and know the placeforthe first time. He nods, strangely moved, moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs the healant and wand. He shuts the cabinet, stares at his reflection in the burnished steel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens the door to the locker. Stares at the brand- new, unworn picture of he and Victoria, taped to the inside of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack comes out into the living area of Sky Tower 2, noticing everything: The furniture, the big things are exactly the same, but the little personal touches, the smaller details are different. He sees it all in a different light now. Things that he never looked twice at before. The items used to keep them from the truth. Victoria 2 comes in from outside, washes her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should watch a movie tonight. He sits, looking around himself. He belongs here. He fits here. Victoria munches on something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going over the catalog and there's still a bunch of your favorites I haven't seen... She glances over, smiles. Who wouldn't forget everything for that smile?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack stares down as the Bubbleship LIFTS OFF from Sky Tower 2. He sees Victoria 2 come out, looking at him puzzled. Then she moves towards her Control Station. After a moment, her voice comes over the Comm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you didn't say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good bye... He turns the Bubbleship, towards
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack touches down in the second Bubbleship. Drone 166 still lies there, but Jack 2 is GONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack clambers into the enclave to where he left Julia. She's passed out, she looks dead. There's blood on the ground around her. He pulls her into his lap, pulling away the clothing around the wound. As he does, her eyes flutter open. She's delirious, eyes fixing on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is gonna pinch a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... He spreads the HEALANT over her wound, activates it. For a moment, nothing. Then the skin starts to knit. And Julia starts to SCREAM...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julia is unconscious, propped in the passenger seat of the ship. Jack climbs in, jams Bob the Bobblehead onto the dash. It bobbles at him, ready. Jack hits the gas and the Bubbleship lifts into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bubbleship soars through the sky. There's something particularly calm, picturesque, exquisitely beautiful about the earth below. Jack pilots. In the seat next to him, Julia is pale, propped against the canopy, recovering. She watches him. He's aware of her gaze, but he doesn't look over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julia weakly stands amidst the tarped supplies, aware she's trespassing somewhere utterly private. Outside, the sound of Jack splitting wood. She takes in the books, the records, the mementos of the past. Sees the Jammer up and working... Jack comes in, gets to work piling wood in the fireplace. He won't meet her eyes. Scared of himself, ashamed in front of her...
direction.name: direction
